name: portrait
description: A portrait the founder and CEO, Bill Lumberg.
use: By now, the portrait only serves to remind employees of who it is that is reponsible for their dull and miserable work environment.
taste: You stealthily approach the portrait and lick it. The varnish on the frame is bitter, like your mood.
touch: As you run touch the frame of the portrait you are amazed at the quality of the wood. You wonder, if only Lumberg used his money to make the company a better place for employees instead of indulging his ego.
smell: You can still smell the paint. It appears the portrait is was very recently painted.
shake: You try to shake the painting but that would attract the attention of the receptionist. You leave the portrait where it is.
break_item: Breaking the painting would attract too much attention, that's the last thing you need!
read: The only thing you can read is Bill Lumberg's smug expression on his face.
